title: How to Make Oven Baked French Toast

steps.headline: Take one French bread roll and bias cut (diagonally cut) it into 2 inch (5.1 cm) slices.
Make a cut halfway in the top of each slice through the bread to make a pocket for the filling if using.
steps.description: (This is optional but results in a much more decadent baked french toast.)

steps.headline: Cover the bread slices, with a tea towel for example, and set aside.
Mix the cream cheese and the ricotta cheese together in a bowl until well combined.
steps.description:
You don't have to use this filling. Use a grated hard cheese as shown if you prefer. This is the base for your filling and you can now experiment with different flavors to mix in. Try adding 1/4 cup sliced strawberries and 1 teaspoon vanilla essence to the cheese mixture. 1/4 cup apricot preserves and 3-4 pieces of finely chopped glace ginger is also very nice. 1/4 cup blueberries and the zest of one lemon would be good as well. You could also make the filling savory by adding mushrooms, spring onions, and ham or bacon. steps.headline: Stuff the pockets of each slice of bread with a tablespoon (or more, if it will fit) of your prepared filling.
Place the stuffed slices of french bread in a shallow baking dish.
Decide how many eggs you will need.
steps.description: Depending on how much bread you have to cover, you will need between 2 and 4 eggs. Start with two and if you find that you need more, you can always add another egg or two.

steps.headline: Break the eggs in a suitable bowl.
steps.description: Whisk the eggs together with 1 tablespoon of milk or cream for each pair of eggs used.

steps.headline: Season your eggs, if desired.
steps.description: At this stage you may wish to add some spices or herbs to your egg mixture. Use vanilla essence, ground ginger, ground cinnamon, or, if savory, try garlic, oregano or chili powder. The flavor combinations  are endless, so don't be afraid to try something new.

steps.headline: Pour the egg mixture over the bread slices in the baking dish.
steps.description: The egg mixture should fully coat all the bread slices and pool around the bottom of the pan. The baking dish will be covered and refrigerated for 4 hours minimum or ideally overnight. The bread will soak up quite a bit of egg mixture, so make sure there is some at the bottom of the pan for the bread to soak up. Leave overnight.

steps.headline: Drain any excess egg mixture from the bottom of the baking dish as this will make serving MUCH easier.
Preheat oven to 160 °C (320 °F).
steps.description: Put the dish into the middle of the oven.

steps.headline: Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the tops of the bread slices are golden brown.
Serve drizzled with syrup and an orange wedge, if sweet.
steps.description: If savory, try serving with caramelized or sauteed onions.

text:
Take one French bread roll and bias cut (diagonally cut) it into 2 inch (5.1 cm) slices. Make a cut halfway in the top of each slice through the bread to make a pocket for the filling if using. (This is optional but results in a much more decadent baked french toast.) Cover the bread slices, with a tea towel for example, and set aside. Mix the cream cheese and the ricotta cheese together in a bowl until well combined. You don't have to use this filling. Use a grated hard cheese as shown if you prefer. This is the base for your filling and you can now experiment with different flavors to mix in. Try adding 1/4 cup sliced strawberries and 1 teaspoon vanilla essence to the cheese mixture. 1/4 cup apricot preserves and 3-4 pieces of finely chopped glace ginger is also very nice. 1/4 cup blueberries and the zest of one lemon would be good as well. You could also make the filling savory by adding mushrooms, spring onions, and ham or bacon. The filling is the fun part so choose your favorite flavors and give it a go. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/86\/Make-Oven-Baked-French-Toast-Step-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Oven-Baked-French-Toast-Step-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/86\/Make-Oven-Baked-French-Toast-Step-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-Oven-Baked-French-Toast-Step-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"} Stuff the pockets of each slice of bread with a tablespoon (or more, if it will fit) of your prepared filling. Place the stuffed slices of french bread in a shallow baking dish. Cover and set aside. Decide how many eggs you will need. Depending on how much bread you have to cover, you will need between 2 and 4 eggs. Start with two and if you find that you need more, you can always add another egg or two. Break the eggs in a suitable bowl. Whisk the eggs together with 1 tablespoon of milk or cream for each pair of eggs used. Season your eggs, if desired. At this stage you may wish to add some spices or herbs to your egg mixture. Use vanilla essence, ground ginger, ground cinnamon, or, if savory, try garlic, oregano or chili powder. The flavor combinations are endless, so don't be afraid to try something new. Pour the egg mixture over the bread slices in the baking dish. The egg mixture should fully coat all the bread slices and pool around the bottom of the pan. The baking dish will be covered and refrigerated for 4 hours minimum or ideally overnight. The bread will soak up quite a bit of egg mixture, so make sure there is some at the bottom of the pan for the bread to soak up. Leave overnight. Drain any excess egg mixture from the bottom of the baking dish as this will make serving MUCH easier. Do this before baking your "toast". Preheat oven to 160 °C (320 °F). Put the dish into the middle of the oven. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the tops of the bread slices are golden brown. Serve drizzled with syrup and an orange wedge, if sweet. If savory, try serving with caramelized or sauteed onions.
